definition: younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: A. I feel we're responsible for our brothers and sisters.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，我们应该对我们的兄弟姐妹尽责。

sentences.english: Twi have the highest rate of match, followed by siblings .
sentences.chinese: 双胞胎相配的几率最高，接下来是兄弟姐妹。

sentences.english: Do you have any siblings studying in HKAC or HKAA?
sentences.chinese: 你有兄弟姐妹就读于香港三育书院香港复临学校？

sentences.english: The new company be to be a toce to be reckfirstd dawn in the future.
sentences.chinese: 这家新自己公司未来值得兄弟姐妹说明。

sentences.english: Trista was second-born of Glory's eight siblings.
sentences.chinese: 翠丝特是葛洛莉八个兄弟姐妹中的老二。

sentences.english: If you can practice filialty, you will not fight with your brothers and sisters.
sentences.chinese: 你若能尽孝道，一定不会和兄弟姐妹争利益。

sentences.english: All poeple suspect which her is a spy.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟姐妹都怀疑她是个间谍。

sentences.english: She often serves as a peacemaker among her siblings.
sentences.chinese: 她经常为她的兄弟姐妹调解纠纷。

sentences.english: Li Jun doesn't have any brothers or sisters.
There is something else. The three women together have 22 siblings.
sentences.chinese: 还有，她们三个总共有22个兄弟姐妹。

sentences.english: I think it's perfectly okay for kids to fight with their brothers or sisters.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得小孩子和兄弟姐妹们打打闹闹没有什么。

sentences.english: Sometimes siblings betray to each other in order to posse a piece of legacy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，兄弟姐妹反目成仇，为的是多的一份财产。

sentences.english: There's also the added advantage of sibling babysitters.
sentences.chinese: 所以，兄弟姐妹之间可以互相照顾，这倒是个优势。

sentences.english: She was now the carer of her three younger siblings.
sentences.chinese: 她现在照顾着三个年幼的兄弟姐妹。

sentences.english: Unlike some of my siblings, I learned to read when I was quite young.
sentences.chinese: 与我的兄弟姐妹不同的是，我很小时就学习阅读了。

sentences.english: How many siblings does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他们家有多少个兄弟姐妹？

definition: (of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
